title: LETTER: Leon’s waste of space | Letters
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK Related articles Springboks’ loss emblematic of a wider downward spiral LETTER: Zuma as monarch TONY Leon takes up most of a page arguing a non sequitur ( Springboks’ loss emblematic of a wider downward spiral , September 23). Question: Why did the Springboks do so badly against Japan? Answer: The black government is so bad.
What a waste of valuable newspaper space. And whatever happened to the age-old liberal principle of taking responsibility? Or is it just too hard to admit that this country cannot depend on only a tiny segment of its population?
Xolela Mangcu
Cape Town
